<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D"></a>

# PhysicsDirectBodyState2D

**Inherits:** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [PhysicsDirectBodyState2DExtension](PhysicsDirectBodyState2DExtension.md)

Provides direct access to a physics body in the [PhysicsServer2D](PhysicsServer2D.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Provides direct access to a physics body in the [PhysicsServer2D](PhysicsServer2D.md), allowing safe changes to physics properties. This object is passed via the direct state callback of [RigidBody2D](RigidBody2D.md), and is intended for changing the direct state of that body. See [RigidBody2D._integrate_forces()](RigidBody2D.md#RigidBody2D_private_method__integrate_forces).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Physics introduction](../tutorials/physics/physics_introduction.md)

- [Ray-casting](../tutorials/physics/ray-casting.md)

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_central_force"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_constant_central_force**\ (\ force\: [Vector2](Vector2.md) = Vector2(0, 0)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_central_force)

Adds a constant directional force without affecting rotation that keeps being applied over time until cleared with ``constant_force = Vector2(0, 0)``.

This is equivalent to using [add_constant_force()](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_force) at the body's center of mass.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_force"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_constant_force**\ (\ force\: [Vector2](Vector2.md), position\: [Vector2](Vector2.md) = Vector2(0, 0)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_force)

Adds a constant positioned force to the body that keeps being applied over time until cleared with ``constant_force = Vector2(0, 0)``.

\ `position` is the offset from the body origin in global coordinates.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_torque"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_constant_torque**\ (\ torque\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_torque)

Adds a constant rotational force without affecting position that keeps being applied over time until cleared with ``constant_torque = 0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_central_force"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **apply_central_force**\ (\ force\: [Vector2](Vector2.md) = Vector2(0, 0)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_central_force)

Applies a directional force without affecting rotation. A force is time dependent and meant to be applied every physics update.

This is equivalent to using [apply_force()](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_force) at the body's center of mass.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_central_impulse"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **apply_central_impulse**\ (\ impulse\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_central_impulse)

Applies a directional impulse without affecting rotation.

An impulse is time-independent! Applying an impulse every frame would result in a framerate-dependent force. For this reason, it should only be used when simulating one-time impacts (use the "_force" functions otherwise).

This is equivalent to using [apply_impulse()](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_impulse) at the body's center of mass.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_force"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **apply_force**\ (\ force\: [Vector2](Vector2.md), position\: [Vector2](Vector2.md) = Vector2(0, 0)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_force)

Applies a positioned force to the body. A force is time dependent and meant to be applied every physics update.

\ `position` is the offset from the body origin in global coordinates.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_impulse"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **apply_impulse**\ (\ impulse\: [Vector2](Vector2.md), position\: [Vector2](Vector2.md) = Vector2(0, 0)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_impulse)

Applies a positioned impulse to the body.

An impulse is time-independent! Applying an impulse every frame would result in a framerate-dependent force. For this reason, it should only be used when simulating one-time impacts (use the "_force" functions otherwise).

\ `position` is the offset from the body origin in global coordinates.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_torque"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **apply_torque**\ (\ torque\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_torque)

Applies a rotational force without affecting position. A force is time dependent and meant to be applied every physics update.

\ **Note:** [inverse_inertia](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_property_inverse_inertia) is required for this to work. To have [inverse_inertia](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_property_inverse_inertia), an active [CollisionShape2D](CollisionShape2D.md) must be a child of the node, or you can manually set [inverse_inertia](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_property_inverse_inertia).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_torque_impulse"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **apply_torque_impulse**\ (\ impulse\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_apply_torque_impulse)

Applies a rotational impulse to the body without affecting the position.

An impulse is time-independent! Applying an impulse every frame would result in a framerate-dependent force. For this reason, it should only be used when simulating one-time impacts (use the "_force" functions otherwise).

\ **Note:** [inverse_inertia](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_property_inverse_inertia) is required for this to work. To have [inverse_inertia](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_property_inverse_inertia), an active [CollisionShape2D](CollisionShape2D.md) must be a child of the node, or you can manually set [inverse_inertia](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_property_inverse_inertia).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_constant_force"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_constant_force**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_constant_force)

Returns the body's total constant positional forces applied during each physics update.

See [add_constant_force()](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_force) and [add_constant_central_force()](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_central_force).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_constant_torque"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **get_constant_torque**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_constant_torque)

Returns the body's total constant rotational forces applied during each physics update.

See [add_constant_torque()](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_torque).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[RID](RID.md) **get_contact_collider**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider)

Returns the collider's [RID](RID.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_contact_collider_id**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_id)

Returns the collider's object id.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_object"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Object](Object.md) **get_contact_collider_object**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_object)

Returns the collider object. This depends on how it was created (will return a scene node if such was used to create it).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_position"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_contact_collider_position**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_position)

Returns the position of the contact point on the collider in the global coordinate system.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_shape"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_contact_collider_shape**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_shape)

Returns the collider's shape index.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_velocity_at_position"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_contact_collider_velocity_at_position**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_collider_velocity_at_position)

Returns the velocity vector at the collider's contact point.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_count"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_contact_count**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_count)

Returns the number of contacts this body has with other bodies.

\ **Note:** By default, this returns 0 unless bodies are configured to monitor contacts. See [RigidBody2D.contact_monitor](RigidBody2D.md#RigidBody2D_property_contact_monitor).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_impulse"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_contact_impulse**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_impulse)

Returns the impulse created by the contact.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_local_normal"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_contact_local_normal**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_local_normal)

Returns the local normal at the contact point.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_local_position"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_contact_local_position**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_local_position)

Returns the position of the contact point on the body in the global coordinate system.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_local_shape"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_contact_local_shape**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_local_shape)

Returns the local shape index of the collision.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_local_velocity_at_position"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_contact_local_velocity_at_position**\ (\ contact_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_contact_local_velocity_at_position)

Returns the velocity vector at the body's contact point.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_space_state"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PhysicsDirectSpaceState2D](PhysicsDirectSpaceState2D.md) **get_space_state**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_space_state)

Returns the current state of the space, useful for queries.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_velocity_at_local_position"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_velocity_at_local_position**\ (\ local_position\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_get_velocity_at_local_position)

Returns the body's velocity at the given relative position, including both translation and rotation.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_integrate_forces"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **integrate_forces**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_integrate_forces)

Updates the body's linear and angular velocity by applying gravity and damping for the equivalent of one physics tick.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_set_constant_force"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_constant_force**\ (\ force\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_set_constant_force)

Sets the body's total constant positional forces applied during each physics update.

See [add_constant_force()](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_force) and [add_constant_central_force()](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_central_force).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_set_constant_torque"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_constant_torque**\ (\ torque\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_set_constant_torque)

Sets the body's total constant rotational forces applied during each physics update.

See [add_constant_torque()](PhysicsDirectBodyState2D.md#PhysicsDirectBodyState2D_method_add_constant_torque).
